page.title: 12WORSHIP IN BRANT BROUGHTON
page.content: There are 3 places of worship in the area being surveyed: The Quaker Meeting House has been in use since 1701.There is a weekly service at 11am.The congregation, who come from a wide area,varies between 15 and 30.Only 4 members live in the village.Provision is made for children on the first and third Sunday of each month.A study group meets monthly. The Methodist Chapel built in 1858 has one Sunday service at 6pm (11am in winter). The congregation averages about 12.There is no Sunday School now but a monthly Family Service has just been started. There is a fortnightly Women's Fellowship Group. At the Wesleyan Reform Chapel, built in 1862 there is one Sunday service at either 11am or 6pm, attended by about 15 people. There is no Sunday School.A monthly home-based bible class is held
